page.title: 01FULFORD introduction
page.content: Fulford, as it is known today, is a result of the amalgamation of two old villages, Gate Fulford and Water Fulford, themselves medieval centres of settlement focused on manors of the same names. During the 18th and 19th centuries Fulford was a thriving village. It boasted its own school, St. Oswald's Parish School, founded in 1771 by John Key, the then lord of the manor of Water Fulford. But as the 20th century raced on the importance of Fulford as a village declined and its function as a residential centre increased. Now Fulford has lost its identity as a village, being enveloped by the residential growth of York.
